content.text:
# List of Cultural Properties of Japan – historical materials (Kumamoto)

This list is of the Cultural Properties of Japan designated in the category of  for the Prefecture of Kumamoto.
National Cultural Properties
As of 1 February 2015, one Important Cultural Property has been designated, being of national significance.

| align="center"|Materials relating to Amakusa Shirō TokisadaAmakusa Shirō Tokisada kankei shiryō ||  || Amakusa || Amakusa Christian Museum || 4 items, including a banner (pictured) used in the Shimabara Rebellion ||  ||  || [https://kunishitei.bunka.go.jp/heritage/detail/201/10146 ]

|}

| align="center"|Rosary and Jarrozario to tsubo ||  || Amakusa || Amakusa Christian Museum || discovered during construction work by the coast in 1965, the seventeenth-century Chinese porcelain jar had inside it a necklace made from antlers, below which was a cross and a miniature image of Mary || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205035223/http://www.city.amakusa.kumamoto.jp/kyouiku/bunkazai/pub/detail.asp?c_id=151&id=38&kbnmst=0&shumst=6&ckimst=0&type=1 ]
|-
| align="center"|Official Bulletin Board Prohibiting Assemblytotō kinshi kōsatsu ||  || Amakusa || Amakusa Christian Museum || the notice prohibits farmers from assembling and promises rewards for informers || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205040302/http://www.city.amakusa.kumamoto.jp/kyouiku/bunkazai/pub/detail.asp?c_id=151&id=39&kbnmst=0&shumst=6&ckimst=0&type=1 ]
|-

|-
| align="center"|Tsunami Memorial Tōtsunami kuyō tō ||  || Kumamoto || || hōkyōintō erected in April 1793 after the tsunami of 1 April 1792 that resulted from a landslide on Mount Unzen || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205043625/http://www.city.kumamoto.jp/html/kyouikuiinnkai/bunka/137_138_.htm ]
|-
| align="center"|Tsunami Memorial Steletsunami kuyō hi ||  || Kumamoto || || || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205043625/http://www.city.kumamoto.jp/html/kyouikuiinnkai/bunka/137_138_.htm ]
|-
| align="center"|Tsunami Memorial Steletsunami kuyō hi (Renkōji) || || Kumamoto ||  || commemorates 765 people from four villages who died in the tsunami || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205043625/http://www.city.kumamoto.jp/html/kyouikuiinnkai/bunka/137_138_.htm ]
|-
| align="center"|Tsunami Memorial Inscriptiontsunami kuyō hi || || Kumamoto || || inscribed boulder commemorating the 1792 tsunami || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205043625/http://www.city.kumamoto.jp/html/kyouikuiinnkai/bunka/137_138_.htm ]
|-
| align="center"|Kumamoto Castle Exit and Entry PermitKumamoto-jō shutsunyū kansatsu tsuketari Enkyō ninen oboegaki || || Kumamoto || Kumamoto Castle || designation includes a note dated Enkyō 2 (1745) || ||  || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150205050629/http://www.city.kumamoto.jp/html/kyouikuiinnkai/bunka/141_kuma.htm ]
